posts.post_content: I use this card combo with [Life and Limb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Life and Limb). This combo allow my token deck to have 5 6/6 tokens with trample on the field in about five turns :P If I throw in a [doubling season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doubling season), my deck becomes even more of a cheating deck than sliver decks lol. The only drawback however being now my lands have summoning sickness, so I gota wait a turn to tap it, but a small price to pay to get this babe rolling.

posts.post_content: This is a card that can change a deck very dramatically. I have a green/blue deck that I play centering around Waiting in the Weeds. Thus, I'm creating oodles of Forest tokens, sometimes having as many as 4 or 5 coming in each turn. When I first played Baru in this deck I though he'd be decent, but not incredible. Very easily he allowed me to swing with 25 points of trampling damage with 2 creatures to end the game. It is simple to use him effectively, yet you can still do some absolutely hysterical things with him.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
The question for me is... When are you able to discard? Is it possible to discard during your upkeep phase? If so the card combo with Genesis would be sick! Any input on this would be excellent!  
Posted By: Rigorousbean  
  
You can, but it won't work the way you want it. Just discard Baru at the beggining of your opponents End Step. That way it will be in the 'yard for Genesis when you want it without all the icky rules getting in the way.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: @Rigorousbean normally, you can only discard at the end of your turn if you have more than seven cards in hand, but with you can discard for this card's effect whenever you need, since it says "discard a baru fist of krosa: put a...", if it said "when you discard baru, fist of krosa..." you would need another way to discard it to use it's effect.
posts.html:
